greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator of {c(n) = if n=1 then 0 else if n < 3*2^[Log2(n)-1] then (c([n/2])+c([(n+1)/2]))/2 else c(n-2^[Log2(n)])+1}.
comment: C(k) = {a(n)/A140130(n): 2^(k-1) <= n < 2^k} = nonnegative Conway numbers created on day k according to the genesis reported by Knuth.
reference: D. E. Knuth, Surreal Numbers, Addison-Wesley, Reading, 1974.
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 14 2008
